definition: to have a prior engagement
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale
(located) at/(to be) in/to exist/in the middle of doing sth/(indicating an action in progress)
early/prior/former/in advance/first

sentences.english: That’s very kind of you but I’m afraid I have a prior engagement.
sentences.chinese: 非常感谢您的好意，不过我已经有约在先了。

sentences.english: Sorry, I'm engaged for this tango .
sentences.chinese: 对不起，这曲探戈我已有约在先了。

sentences.english: I fear that a prior engagement will prohibit me from joining you in dinner.
sentences.chinese: 我有约在先，恐怕不能与你共进晚餐。

sentences.english: I am unable to attend because of a previous engagement.
sentences.chinese: 我因有约在先故不能出席。

sentences.english: I'd love to, but I have a prior engagement.
sentences.chinese: 我非常想去，但是我和别人有约在先。

sentences.english: I cannot see you on Monday because I have a previous engagement.
sentences.chinese: 星期一我不能和你见面，因为我有约在先了。

sentences.english: Sorry, I am engaged for the social dance.
sentences.chinese: 抱歉，这交际舞我有约在先了。

sentences.english: I fear that a prior engagement will prohibit me from joining you at dinner.
sentences.chinese: 我有约在先，恐怕不能与你共进晚餐。

sentences.english: I was unable to attend the meeting because of a prior engagement.
sentences.chinese: 我因有约在先，所以未能参加这个会。

sentences.english: Sorry, I'm engaged for the social dance.
sentences.chinese: 抱歉，这曲交谊舞我已经有约在先了。

sentences.english: I was unable to attend because of a engagement.
sentences.chinese: 我因有约在先，无法出席。

sentences.english: I was unable to attend the party because of a prior appointment.
sentences.chinese: 由于和别人有约在先，我不能参加晚会。

definition: to renege/to go back (on a deal)/to back out (of a promise)
old: to reap the consequences of one's words (idiom, from Mencius); modern: to go back on one's word/to blow hot and cold/to contradict oneself/inconsistent
lit. to eat one's words/to break a promise/to go back on one's word/to renege/unsworn testimony
to force someone to do something
to give one's assent/to consent
let's talk about the unpleasant things first/let's be frank
pinyin: chou3 hua4 shuo1 zai4 qian2 tou5

definition: to say clearly/to argue clearly/to pronounce/pronounced
to go back on one's word/to break one's promise/to be unfaithful/to be untrustworthy
to agree on three laws (idiom)/three-point covenant/(fig.) preliminary agreement/basic rules
to meet on the battlefield (idiom)
peaceful measures before using force (idiom); diplomacy before violence/jaw-jaw is better than war-war
lit. to go to war without just cause (idiom)/to act without justification
to push sb too far/to go too far (in oppressing people)
lit. to grow fat eating one's words (idiom)/fig. not to live up to one's promises
can't come to an agreement
not to mince words/not to beat about the bush
pinyin: da3 kai1 tian1 chuang1 shuo1 liang4 hua4
